component.name: CPU
CPU
component.description: The central processing unit (CPU) is the brain of the computer. It is responsible for carrying out instructions and processing data.

component.name: GPU
GPU
component.description: The graphics processing unit (GPU) is responsible for rendering graphics. It is used for gaming, video editing, and other graphics-intensive tasks.

component.name: RAM
RAM
component.description: Random access memory (RAM) is used to store data that the CPU is currently working on. The more RAM a computer has, the faster it can run.

component.name: Storage
Storage
component.description: Storage is used to store data permanently. There are two main types of storage: hard drives and solid state drives (SSDs). Hard drives are cheaper but slower than SSDs.

component.name: Power supply
Power supply
component.description: The power supply provides power to the other components in the computer. It is important to choose a power supply that is powerful enough to support the other components in your computer.

component.name: Motherboard
Motherboard
component.description: The motherboard is the main circuit board in the computer. It connects all of the other components together.

component.name: Case
Case
component.description: The case is the enclosure that houses all of the other components in the computer. It protects the components from dust and other damage.
